Operation 'timeOffRequestsAdd' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original description is identical to summary and provides no actionable details. Improved version clarifies the operation creates a new request, specifies expected inputs (employee ID, dates, type), explains the return value (created object with ID and timestamps), and documents the initial state (pending approval) as a side effect. This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation and what to expect.

data.summary_suggestion: Create a new employee time off request
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new time off request for an employee. Accepts time off request details including employee ID, start date, end date, and request type. Returns the created time off request object with a unique identifier and timestamps. The request is initially in a pending state pending manager approval.
data.reasoning: Original description is identical to summary and provides no actionable details. Improved version clarifies the operation creates a new request, specifies expected inputs (employee ID, dates, type), explains the return value (created object with ID and timestamps), and documents the initial state (pending approval) as a side effect. This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation and what to expect.

message: Operation 'timeOffRequestsOne' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_output_details. Original description lacks specificity about what is returned and what parameters are required. Enhanced version clarifies the retrieval scope (specific request by IDs), documents the response content (status, dates, type, approval info), and explicitly states required parameters. This enables AI agents to understand the operation's scope and determine if they have necessary identifiers.

data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve a specific employee time off request
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a specific time off request for an employee by employee ID and request ID. Returns the complete time off request object including status, dates, type, and approval information. Requires valid employee_id and request id parameters.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks specificity about what is returned and what parameters are required. Enhanced version clarifies the retrieval scope (specific request by IDs), documents the response content (status, dates, type, approval info), and explicitly states required parameters. This enables AI agents to understand the operation's scope and determine if they have necessary identifiers.

message: Operation 'timeOffRequestsUpdate' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original description is too generic and doesn't explain partial update behavior or side effects. Improved version clarifies that this is a PATCH operation supporting partial updates, specifies what can be updated, documents the return value, explains the partial update semantics, and notes potential workflow side effects. This helps AI agents understand the operation's scope and behavior.

data.summary_suggestion: Update an existing employee time off request
data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing time off request for an employee using partial update semantics. Accepts updates to request details such as dates, type, or status. Returns the updated time off request object. Only provided fields are modified; omitted fields retain their current values. May trigger approval workflow changes depending on status modifications.
data.reasoning: Original description is too generic and doesn't explain partial update behavior or side effects. Improved version clarifies that this is a PATCH operation supporting partial updates, specifies what can be updated, documents the return value, explains the partial update semantics, and notes potential workflow side effects. This helps AI agents understand the operation's scope and behavior.

message: Operation 'timeOffRequestsDelete' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original description lacks critical details about what happens after deletion and constraints on deletion. Enhanced version clarifies the deletion scope (specific request by IDs), documents the response (success with ID), explains the irreversible nature of deletion, and notes typical business constraints (only pending/rejected requests). This helps AI agents understand the operation's consequences and when it's appropriate to use.

data.summary_suggestion: Delete an employee time off request
data.description_suggestion: Deletes a specific time off request for an employee by employee ID and request ID. Returns a success response with the deleted request ID. Removes the time off request from the system; this action cannot be undone. Only pending or rejected requests can typically be deleted.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks critical details about what happens after deletion and constraints on deletion. Enhanced version clarifies the deletion scope (specific request by IDs), documents the response (success with ID), explains the irreversible nature of deletion, and notes typical business constraints (only pending/rejected requests). This helps AI agents understand the operation's consequences and when it's appropriate to use.

message: Operation 'departmentsDelete' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context, missing_side_effects, not_actionable. Original summary and description are identical and overly simplistic. Added clarity about what is being deleted (by ID), the permanent nature of the operation, required parameters, return value, and potential side effects for AI agent decision-making.

data.description_suggestion: Permanently deletes a department identified by the provided ID. This operation removes the department record from the HRIS system. Requires the department ID as a path parameter. Returns a confirmation of the deletion. Note: Deleting a department may have cascading effects on associated employees or organizational structures depending on system configuration.
data.reasoning: Original summary and description are identical and overly simplistic. Added clarity about what is being deleted (by ID), the permanent nature of the operation, required parameters, return value, and potential side effects for AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'payrollsAll' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context, missing_output_details. Original description lacks any detail about pagination, filtering, or what data is returned. Added information about pagination support (cursor/limit), return structure, and use cases to help AI agents understand when and how to use this operation.

data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of all payroll records in the HRIS system. Supports filtering, sorting, and pagination through query parameters (cursor and limit). Returns an array of payroll objects with metadata including pagination cursors for navigating through results. Use this operation to retrieve multiple payroll records for reporting or analysis purposes.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks any detail about pagination, filtering, or what data is returned. Added information about pagination support (cursor/limit), return structure, and use cases to help AI agents understand when and how to use this operation.

message: Operation 'payrollsOne' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original description provides no context about required parameters or return values. Added clarity about the required payroll_id parameter, what is returned, and the operation's purpose for AI agent interpretability.

data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a single payroll record by its unique payroll ID. Requires the payroll_id path parameter to identify which payroll to fetch. Returns the complete payroll object containing all payroll details and associated metadata. Use this operation when you need detailed information about a specific payroll.
data.reasoning: Original description provides no context about required parameters or return values. Added clarity about the required payroll_id parameter, what is returned, and the operation's purpose for AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'employeePayrollsAll' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_output_details. Description is too brief and lacks pagination context. Added information about pagination support, the employee_id requirement, return structure, and use cases to improve AI agent understanding of when to use this operation.

data.summary_suggestion: List all payrolls for an employee
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of all payroll records associated with a specific employee, identified by employee_id. Supports filtering, sorting, and pagination through query parameters (cursor and limit). Returns an array of payroll objects for the specified employee with metadata including pagination cursors. Use this operation to retrieve an employee's complete payroll history or current payroll information.
data.reasoning: Description is too brief and lacks pagination context. Added information about pagination support, the employee_id requirement, return structure, and use cases to improve AI agent understanding of when to use this operation.

message: Operation 'employeePayrollsOne' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Description lacks detail about required parameters and return values. Added clarity about both required path parameters (employee_id and payroll_id), what is returned, and the operation's purpose for better AI agent decision-making.

data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve a specific payroll for an employee
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a single payroll record for a specific employee. Requires both employee_id and payroll_id path parameters to identify the employee and their specific payroll record. Returns the complete payroll object containing all payroll details for that employee. Use this operation when you need detailed information about a specific payroll for a particular employee.
data.reasoning: Description lacks detail about required parameters and return values. Added clarity about both required path parameters (employee_id and payroll_id), what is returned, and the operation's purpose for better AI agent decision-making.

data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of all time off requests in the HRIS system. Supports filtering, sorting, and pagination through query parameters (cursor and limit). Returns an array of time off request objects containing details such as employee, request dates, status, and type. Use this operation to retrieve time off requests for reporting, approval workflows, or employee leave management.

message: Operation 'employeesAll' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Current description explains architectural limitations but lacks clarity on what data is returned and how to use pagination. AI agents need to understand that this returns partial data, how to get complete data, and what parameters control the response. Enhanced summary is more action-oriented and specific about pagination.

data.current_description: Apideck operates as a stateless Unified API, which means that the list endpoint only provides a portion of the employee model. This is due to the fact that most HRIS systems do not readily provide all data in every call. However, you can access the complete employee model through an employee detail call.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of employees from the HRIS system. Note that this endpoint returns a partial employee model due to stateless API design and HRIS system limitations. For complete employee details including all fields, use the Get Employee endpoint with a specific employee ID. Supports filtering, sorting, and cursor-based pagination via limit and cursor parameters.
data.reasoning: Current description explains architectural limitations but lacks clarity on what data is returned and how to use pagination. AI agents need to understand that this returns partial data, how to get complete data, and what parameters control the response. Enhanced summary is more action-oriented and specific about pagination.
